snippet: The eruption of Mount Ontake in central Japan on Saturday, which has so far left 47 people dead, took experienced mountaineers and locals by surprise.
abstract: Japan is still struggling to count the dead, four days after worst volcanic disaster in its recent history; tragedy caught both experienced mountaineers and locals who revere Mount Ontake by surprise; 47 bodies have been found but officials remain uncertain on how high total could rise because they do not know how many people were on mountain.

byline.contributor: Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Otaki, and Makiko Inoue from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: The eruption of Mount Ontake in central Japan on Saturday, which has so far left 47 people dead, took experienced mountaineers and locals by surprise.

headline.main: In Japan, Fear and Panic as a Revered Peak Explodes
headline.print_headline: In Japan, Fear and Panic as a Revered Peak Exploded
